abstracts.cdata!:
The credit supports the
            Government's program of structural adjustment and
            stabilization. It aims at increasing investment and economic
            growth by reducing controls, accelerating efficient use of
            domestic and foreign resources, and promoting exports. The
            program contains several elements including (i)
            macro-economic policies to strengthen the country's
            budgetary and external finances and maintain a realistic
            exchange rate; (ii) liberalizing foreign trade and
            industrial policies; and (iii) reducing and improving the
            focus of government interventions in the agricultural
            sector. In addition, the credit supports (iv) commencing the
            restructuring of public sector enterprises and improving
            their administration; and (v) improving the administration
            of development expenditures.
